A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I went in with low expectations. They were met. 
Not to say it didn't have it's highlights; Mark Hamill is great as is his dynamic with Daisy Ridley. Excellent visual effects and beyond lavish production means the film always looks incredible. It also wasn't just a rehash of Empire so that's good.

I'd say pretty much everything else was a bit of a mess though. A pointless and convoluted plot involving Finn and Rose going to the Casino Nights Zone from Sonic 2\, a baffling waste of characters and setups from previous films\, painfully awkward humour that killed any drama and a wedge of Disney cheese sprinkled on top. And oh boy\, THAT scene with Leia...

Star Wars has been more of a product for decades but it's never been more apparent than now. Better than the prequels? Sure. Better than Empire? Get outta here with your paid for reviews\, ya mook.
